messages.title: 60 SECOND Q&A
messages.content: Michael Ellis answers questions on economy, NHS, crime, education, and politics.

messages.title: A PERSONAL MESSAGE FROM DAVID CAMERON
messages.content: David Cameron emphasizes the need for change and outlines Conservative pledges on the NHS, economy, apprenticeships, and taxes.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Work for fairer pensions and benefits.
Support local police and cut down on paperwork.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Northampton North is a marginal seat that could help secure a Conservative victory.

issues.economy: Recovery will come from homes, from individuals, from the private sector, not just government.
issues.education: Schools need support to manage class size and provide every child with a good school place.
issues.governance: We are in difficult times, politics are changing.
issues.health: The NHS is our most important national treasure and will be protected.
issues.socialWelfare: Policies aim to support pensioners and provide fairer benefits.

leaflet.personalStatement: Michael has always lived and worked in Northampton, he understands the local needs and has dedication to public service.

politicalExperience.achievements: Active local involvement, understands the town's needs.

endorsements.endorsement: Supporting change in Britain, endorsing Conservative policies.

images.caption: Michael Ellis working with various groups.
